commitResults.messageTitle: Level 0: Implement initial skeleton of chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
Chatbot has default name.

Chatbot should be given a new name to differentiate it from the
placeholder name Duke.

Let's,
* change the name of the chatbot
* make chatbot greets the user and exit

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 0: Rename Duke.java to match chatbot name

commitResults.messageBody:
Chatbot exits immediately after greeting user.

Chatbot should be able to listen and react to user command.

Let's,
* make chatbot repeat command provided by user
* make chatbot exit when user types command "bye"

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 2: Add functionality for storing and listing user commands
commitResults.messageBody:
Chatbot currently lacks functionality.

Store user commands so that user can display them back when requested.

Let's,
* include the list command to display all stored user commands
* store other commands in the chatbot's memory

commitResults.messageTitle: Optional: Refactor code to remove repeated print statements

commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks are complex and include more than just the name.

The Task class allows programmers to abstract details about the tasks,
such as its name and completion. This adds functionality to the
chatbot which can mark tasks as done.

Let's,
* add the ability to mark tasks as done
* add the ability to unmark tasks as not done

Tasks are too generic.

There are many other tasks, such as to-do, deadlines, and events.

Let's,
* add different types of tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 4: Add support for tracking to-dos, deadlines and events
commitResults.messageBody:
ToDo, Deadline, and Event classes are currently not supported by the
chatbot.

The chatbot should be able to support these three tasks as the user
requires it.

Let's,
* add functionality for ToDo, Deadline, and Event

Chatbot is not tested properly.

Add test cases for chatbot to ensure that it works as intended.

Let's,
* Add I/O redirection for the chatbot

commitResults.messageTitle: Optional: Refactor by converting to switch-case for readability
Optional: Modify chatbot reply for bye command
Level 5: Add error handling for invalid inputs
commitResults.messageBody:
Invalid inputs are allowed.

Chatbot should handle invalid inputs gracefully.

Let's,
* handle invalid inputs appropriately
* inform user what has gone wrong with their input

commitResults.messageTitle: Optional: Make Task class abstract to prevent accidental init
Level 6: Add support for deleting task
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks cannot be deleted and will remain on the list indefinitely.

A user would want to remove tasks that are useless.

Let's,
* make deletion of tasks possible
* create test case for deleting task

Commands are treated as string directly from user.

Commands can be treated as a predefined collection.

Let's,
* make commands an Enum for modularization

commitResults.messageTitle: Optional: Add citation for chatbot introduction

commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks are currently handled independently by main logic.

A Task manager allows all tasks to be managed by a single entity while enabling tasks to be saved to hard disk.

Let's,
* save tasks in hard disk automatically with each update
* manage all tasks with a task manager

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 7: Load the data from the hard disk
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks in hard disk should be loaded, otherwise saving is pointless.

Let's,
* add the ability to load task from hard disk

Chatbot currently does not understand datetimes in Deadline and Event.

Chatbot should understand datetime to print datetime neatly.

Let's,
* add datetime functionality for chatbot.

commitResults.messageTitle: Optional: Make boolean variables sound boolean
Optional: Fix coding convention for constants

commitResults.messageBody:
Closely related code are all found in the main code.

Related code can be transformed into separate classes.

Let's,
* make the code more OOP

Closely related code are all found in the main code.

Related code can be transformed into separate classes.

Let's,
* make code more OOP
* create commands as classes

commitResults.messageTitle: A-MoreOOP: Split TaskManager into TaskStorage and TaskList
commitResults.messageBody:
TaskManager currently handles all tasks.

TaskManager can be split into TaskStorage and TaskList.

Let's,
* make TaskStorage deal with loading and saving tasks to file
* make TaskList contain the task list

YoshikageKira is currently not in a package.

All files should be placed in a package.

Let's,
* organize the classes into suitable java packages

commitResults.messageTitle: A-Gradle: Automate project builds using Gradle
commitResults.messageBody:
Project build is handled by IDEA.

Gradle is a build automation tool that can help
automate some of the build tasks.

Let's
* provide Gradle support

There are no tests to determine correctness.

Add JUnit tests to test the behavior of the code.

Let's,
* test program reasonably well

commitResults.messageTitle: A-Jar: Package the app as a JAR file
commitResults.messageBody:
App is currently not packaged.

Users of the app need a way to execute it.

Let's,
* distribute the app with an executable JAR file
